intro: Oreogrammitis tenuisecta, commonly known as the slender frond moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are typically recurved and have a distinct midrib. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rock surfaces or in woodland areas. Its small, compact growth habit makes it well adapted to colonize rocky substrates. Oreogrammitis tenuisecta is known for its resilience to desiccation, which allows it to survive in harsh, arid conditions.
